div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D defines the following codes:

tr.td: Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine library list of codes applies in this data element
Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when each vaccine was administered to the client
The date and time of the client's contact
The antenatal care (ANC) contact or visit number
Vaccine dose number including dose number within series
The current status or recommendation for a specific immunization for an client
The client is not currently eligible or scheduled for the specified immunization
The client is currently eligible and should receive the specified immunization based on the recommended schedule
The client has received the specified immunization(s) based on the recommended schedule
The specified immunization is not recommended for the client due to contraindications
Additional assessment is necessary before making a recommendation regarding the specified immunization
Specific situations or medical conditions for which it is advised or recommended to avoid or delay administering a particular vaccine
The client is known to be immunocompromised
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised
The client is undergoing immunosuppressive treatment or was exposed to immunosuppressive treatment in utero or via breastfeeding.
The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
The client has immunodeficiency syndromes (e.g. HIV/AIDS, known or suspected congenital immunodeficiency, leukaemia, lymphoma or other malignant disease)
The client is known to have history of anaphylaxis in the past
The client is known to have severe allergic reaction
The client is experiencing HIV-related symptoms
Planning to get pregnant in the next month
The client's intention or desire is to become pregnant in the next month
The client is receiving blood or blood-related products as part of a medical treatment.
The client has a severe acute illness
The client has been diagnosed with tuberculosis (TB)
The client has exstrophy of urinary bladder
The client has moderate to severe fever
The client has prior history of intussusception
The client's immune system is not functioning at its typical capacity
The client has heightened sensitivity or allergic reactions to specific components found in vaccines
The client is currently taking antibiotics to treat certain infections
Client education and counselling on immunization
Providing information, guidance and support to client or caretakers (such as parents or legal guardians) regarding immunization practices
Counselling on functions of the immunological system
Explaining to the client or caregiver how the vaccines work by triggering the body to produce an immune response
Advising about functions of the immunological system
Explaining to the client or caregiver how the vaccines work by triggering the body to produce an immune response
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
Awareness raising to influence immunization behaviours
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
The current status of the individual immunization event
The immunization event was successfully carried out as intended

Immunization event record has been mistakenly created or entered into the system. Recorded information is incorrect or should not have been documented, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it
Planned immunization event was not carried out for some reason
The reason this immunization event was not performed
Testing has shown that the client already has immunity to the agent targeted by the immunization
The client currently has a medical condition for which the vaccine is contraindicated or for which precaution is warranted
There was no supply of the product on hand to perform the service
The client or their guardian objects to receiving the vaccine
The client's caregiver refused the vaccine
The immunization event was not carried out for an unspecified reason
Client allergy to vaccine or component
The immunization event was not carried out because of client allergy to vaccine or component
The immunization event was not carried out because the client is immunocompromised
The immunization event was not carried out due a chronic illness or condition of the client
The immunization event was not carried out due to an acute illness present in the client
The immunization event was not carried out due to the client having had the disease
Immunization not carried out for other reasons
The immunization event was not carried out for other reasons
The brand or trade name used to refer to the vaccine received
Uses a living but weakened version of the virus or one that is very similar
The service delivery country where the vaccine administration occurred
The service delivery location (location name, city, municipality, town or village) where the vaccine administration occurred
The manufacturer of the vaccine product
Batch number or lot number of vaccine
Name of the market authorization holder of the vaccine received. If market authorization holder is unknown, vaccine manufacturer is REQUIRED
The expiration date of the vaccine
The quantity of vaccine product that was administered

The person, organization or role of the entity that performed the act of giving the vaccine to the client. The implementing system can choose to populate this field using data from a health worker registry or health-care facility registry
The recommended number of doses for immunity according to the national immunization schedule (which may be based on product, age, etc.)
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is typhoid
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is influenza
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is measles
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is pertussis
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is mumps
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is varicella
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is viral hepatitis A
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is TB
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is viral hepatitis B
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib)
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is tetanus
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is rotavirus
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is human papillomavirus (HPV) infection
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is Japanese encephalitis (JE)
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is poliomyelitis (polio)
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is diphtheria
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is pneumococcal
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is rubella
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is dengue
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is rabies
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is meningococcal
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is cholera
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is yellow fever
The vaccine-preventable disease being targeted is coronovirus disease (COVID-19)
Date on which the next vaccination should be administered, if a next dose is required
Indicates observation of an adverse event/reaction
The manifestation of the reaction (e.g. infected abscess, swelling, rash, hives, diarrhoea, etc.) observed after administering the vaccine
The client's reaction manifested in severe local reaction
The client's reaction manifested in seizures
The client's reaction manifested in an abscess
The client's reaction manifested in sepsis
The client's reaction manifested in encephalopathy
The client's reaction manifested in toxic shock syndrome
The client's reaction manifested in anaphylaxis
The client's reaction manifested as a fever
The client's reaction manifested in another way
If the event resulted in a reaction, what is the type of reaction
The reaction resulted in a mild or minor response and did not pose a significant threat to client's health
The reaction resulted in the client's death
The reaction threatened the client's life
The reaction resulted in a disability
The reaction resulted in a hospitalization
The reaction was a congenital anomaly or birth defect
There was another important reaction or medical event
The outcome of the reaction (e.g. death, recovered, recovering)
The adverse event resulted in the client's death
The client has recovered with sequelae as a consequence of the reaction/vaccination
The client's reaction outcome is unknown
Date the client is to return for next vaccination
Date when follow-up is recommended based on vaccination schedule
Indicates if a digital certificate is required
The authority or authorized organization that issued the vaccination certificate
Unique identifier used to associate the immunization event represented in a paper vaccination card to its digital representation(s)
Date in which the certificate for an immunization event became valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Last date in which the certificate for an immunization event is valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Version of the core data set and HL7 Fast Health Interoperability Resources (FHIR) implementation guide that the certificate is using
Indicates if the client received a dose within 24 hours of birth. Whether a birth dose is counted as part of the primary series will depend on the antigen
The type of dose in a series that the client received
Indicates that the client received the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. This is also applicable for antigens with one dose
Indicates that the client received a dose of a product/ antigen that is not a part of the primary vaccination series and is administered before the primary vaccination series is provided
Indicates that the client received a supplementary dose of a product/antigen
Indicates that the client received booster dose of a product/antigen

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen
Date when primary vaccination series was completed
The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current HIV status of the client
The client is known to be HIV-positive
The client is known to be HIV-negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)
Type of TB infection test performed
The type of tuberculosis (TB) infection test performed
Records the result of the TB infection test
The client is living with HIV and is immunologically stable with CD4 count or percentage above a minimum as defined in the HIV guidelines
The client is living with HIV and is clinically well, as defined in HIV guidelines and WHO clinical staging
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the poliovirus vaccine dose administered to the client
The date on which the client started or restarted ART
The client is at high risk for pneumococcal infection because of underlying medical conditions (i.e. HIV infection or sickle-cell disease)
The type of Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived JE vaccine type
The type of tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for TBE
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for TBE
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for TBE
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for TBE
The type of typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
The type of cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed WC
The type of meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Polysaccharide vaccines not including polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccines
Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose
The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose
The type of hepatitis A-containing vaccine dose administered to the client
The type of hepatitis B-containing vaccine dose administered to the client

Vaccine-induced neutralizing antibody (VNA) level, measured as a serum antibody concentration from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture-derived and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)
Risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus
Professional at risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus, particularly animal health workers. Also considered for medical professionals who regularly provide care to persons with rabies
Indicates the result of a serological test determining whether the client has antibodies against the dengue virus
The client has detectable antibodies against the dengue virus, suggesting past exposure or vaccination
The client does not have detectable antibodies, indicating no previous exposure or vaccination against the dengue virus
The client's dengue serostatus is unknown

The client is experiencing HIV-related symptoms

The client has acute gastroenteritis

Indicates observation of an adverse event/reaction
When adverse event/reaction started
The manifestation of the reaction (e.g. infected abscess, swelling, rash, hives, diarrhoea, etc.) observed after administering the vaccine
The client's reaction manifested in severe local reaction
The client's reaction manifested in seizures
The client's reaction manifested in an abscess
The client's reaction manifested in sepsis
The client's reaction manifested in encephalopathy
The client's reaction manifested in toxic shock syndrome
The client's reaction manifested in anaphylaxis
The client's reaction manifested as a fever
The client's reaction manifested in another way
If the event resulted in a reaction, what is the type of reaction
The reaction resulted in a mild or minor response and did not pose a significant threat to client's health
The reaction resulted in the client's death
The reaction threatened the client's life
The reaction resulted in a disability
The reaction resulted in a hospitalization
The reaction was a congenital anomaly or birth defect
There was another important reaction or medical event
The outcome of the reaction (e.g. death, recovered, recovering)
The adverse event resulted in the client's death
The client fully recovered
The client has recovered with sequelae as a consequence of the reaction/vaccination
The client is recovering
The client has not recovered
The client's reaction outcome is unknown
Date the client is to return for next vaccination
Date when follow-up is recommended based on vaccination schedule
Indicates if a digital certificate is required
The authority or authorized organization that issued the vaccination certificate
Unique identifier used to associate the immunization event represented in a paper vaccination card to its digital representation(s)
Date in which the certificate for an immunization event became valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Last date in which the certificate for an immunization event is valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Version of the core data set and HL7 Fast Health Interoperability Resources (FHIR) implementation guide that the certificate is using
Indicates if the client received a dose within 24 hours of birth. Whether a birth dose is counted as part of the primary series will depend on the antigen
The type of dose in a series that the client received
Indicates that the client received the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. This is also applicable for antigens with one dose
Indicates that the client received a dose of a product/ antigen that is not a part of the primary vaccination series and is administered before the primary vaccination series is provided
Indicates that the client received a supplementary dose of a product/antigen
Indicates that the client received booster dose of a product/antigen

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen

display.value: Date when primary vaccination series was completed

definition.value: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current HIV status of the client
The client is known to be HIV-positive
The client is known to be HIV-negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)

display.value: Type of TB infection test performed

definition.value: The type of tuberculosis (TB) infection test performed
Interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA)
Tuberculin skin test (TST)
Records the result of the TB infection test
Test result was positive
Test result was negative
The client is living with HIV and is immunologically stable with CD4 count or percentage above a minimum as defined in the HIV guidelines
The client is living with HIV and is clinically well, as defined in HIV guidelines and WHO clinical staging
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the poliovirus vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated polio vaccine (IPV)
Bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV)
The date on which the client started or restarted ART
The client is at high risk for pneumococcal infection because of underlying medical conditions (i.e. HIV infection or sickle-cell disease)
The type of Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived JE vaccine type
Live attenuated JE vaccine type
Live recombinant JE vaccine type
The type of tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for TBE
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for TBE
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for TBE
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for TBE
The type of typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
Typbar typhoid conjugate vaccine (Typbar-TCV)
Vi polysaccharide (ViPS) vaccine
Ty21a vaccine
The type of cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Killed whole-cell (WC) only cholera vaccine
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed WC
The type of meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Monovalent serogroup A (MenA) conjugate vaccine (5µg)
Monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine
Quadrivalent conjugate (A,C,W135,Y-D and A,C,W135,Y-CRM) vaccines
Polysaccharide vaccines not including polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccines

display.value: Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose

definition.value: The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose
The type of hepatitis A-containing vaccine dose administered to the client
Live attenuated hepatitis A vaccine
Inactivated hepatitis A vaccine
The type of hepatitis B-containing vaccine dose administered to the client
Hepatitis B monovalent vaccine
Hepatitis B combination vaccine

Vaccine-induced neutralizing antibody (VNA) level, measured as a serum antibody concentration from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture-derived and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)

display.value: Risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus

definition.value: Professional at risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus, particularly animal health workers. Also considered for medical professionals who regularly provide care to persons with rabies
Indicates the result of a serological test determining whether the client has antibodies against the dengue virus
The client has detectable antibodies against the dengue virus, suggesting past exposure or vaccination
The client does not have detectable antibodies, indicating no previous exposure or vaccination against the dengue virus
The client's dengue serostatus is unknown
